p: Molecular detection of WNV has been reviewed recently by Shi and Kramer [ 120]. Such assays usually detect between 40 and 100 genome copies, although some suggest that sensitivity can be even lower [ 121]. Further developments have enabled multiplexing with other arboviral diseases [ 122, 123] and improved assay sensitivity [ 124] suggesting that the detection limit is 0.07 genome copies/mL. RT-LAMP assays have been developed for WNV [ 125] and used to detect the virus in mosquito samples [ 126]. The sensitivity limit of these assays has been reported to be approximately 0.1â€‰PFU.
